parameters.name: problemset
parameters.description: Which set should be used? hard5 is a standard set of 5 difficult 15x15 mazes. standard25 are pregenerated from seeds 1 to 25, and will be sampled from. random samples from over a million possible seeds and regenerates the problem each time. If you change the problem size, you will get different problems.

parameters.name: problems
parameters.description: Which problems to use from the standard25 set

parameters.name: numproblems
parameters.description: How many problems. We either sample this many from the problem list (if problemset is standard25), or generate this many new.

parameters.name: mazeWidth
parameters.description: number of cells wide the maze is, if we generate. This can take a while if you make the maze too big.

parameters.name: mazeHeight
parameters.description: number of cells high the maze is, if we generate. This can take a while if you make the maze too big.

parameters.name: mazepixelWidth
parameters.description: number of pixels wide the maze is displayed.

parameters.name: mazepixelHeight
parameters.description: number of pixels high the maze is displayed.

parameters.name: savemazes
parameters.description: whether copies of the maze files should be saved to the data directory

parameters.name: showpreview
parameters.description: Time, in ms, to show the preview of the correct solution.  using this might be an appropriate no-planning control condition, or a short memory test. When set to 0, subject gets planning time instead.

parameters.name: allowplanning
parameters.description: Whether planning time should be allowed. This is overriden by showpreview, where the execution starts immediately.
